TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CookieParameter extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter

summary.span: 将客户端 HTTP Cookie 的值绑定到参数对象。

span.span: Binds the value of a client-side HTTP cookie to a parameter object.

summary.span: 该参数可以在参数化的查询或命令中使用，以选择、筛选或更新数据。

span.span: The parameter can be used in a parameterized query or command to select, filter, or update data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以使用 类将作为 HTTP 请求的一部分传递的客户端 HTTP cookie 的值绑定到 ASP.NET 数据源控件所使用的参数。You can use the class to bind the value of a client-side HTTP cookie passed as part of an HTTP request to a parameter used by ASP.NET data source controls. 类提供 属性，该属性标识要绑定到的 对象的名称，以及从 类继承的对象的名称。The class provides the property, which identifies the name of the object to bind to, in addition to those inherited from the class. 每次调用 方法时， 类都会尝试绑定到已命名的 cookie。The class attempts to bind to the named cookie every time the method is called. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果指定了 对象，但未随 HTTP 请求传递相应的 cookie，则将数据绑定到参数的控件可能会引发异常。Controls that bind data to the parameter might throw an exception if a object is specified, but no corresponding cookie is passed with the HTTP request. 同样，如果通过 `null`传递 cookie，则它们可能不显示任何数据。Similarly, they might display no data if the cookie is passed with `null`. 设置 属性，以在适当的情况下避免出现这些情况。Set the property to avoid these situations where appropriate. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 控件以及绑定到 HTTP cookie 的 对象在 控件中显示 Northwind 商贸数据库中的数据。The following code example demonstrates how to use a control and object bound to an HTTP cookie to display data from the Northwind Traders database in a control. [!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1/CS/cp1cs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1/VB/cp1vb.aspx#1)]

summary.span: 获取或设置参数绑定到的 HTTP Cookie 的名称。

span.span: Gets or sets the name of the HTTP cookie that the parameter binds to.

value.span: 一个字符串，该字符串标识参数绑定到的客户端 HTTP Cookie。

span.span: A string that identifies the client-side HTTP cookie that the parameter binds to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性标识 HTTP cookie，该 cookie 由 对象表示，并通过当前 对象提供。The property identifies an HTTP cookie, which is represented by an object and is available through the current object. 如果 HTTP cookie 在当前 对象中不可用，则 方法会将参数绑定到 属性的值（如果已设置）。If the HTTP cookie is not available in the current object, the method binds the parameter to the value of the property, if it is set. 如果未设置 属性， 方法将无法将参数绑定到某个值。If the property is not set, the method fails to bind the parameter to a value. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何以声明方式使用 控件和绑定到 HTTP cookie 的 对象在 控件中显示 Northwind 商贸数据库中的数据。The following code example demonstrates how to declaratively use a control and a object bound to an HTTP cookie to display data from the Northwind Traders database in a control. [!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1/CS/cp1cs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_1/VB/cp1vb.aspx#1)] 下面的代码示例演示如何以编程方式创建 对象，设置其属性，并将其添加到 控件的 集合。The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically create a object, set its properties, and add it to a control's collection. [!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_2#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_2/CS/cookieparam2cs.aspx.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_2#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter_2/VB/cookieparam2vb.aspx.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用 `context` 参数检索 cookie 集合以及 对象绑定到的 cookie 的值。The `context` parameter is used by the method to retrieve the cookies collection and the value of the cookie that the object binds to. `control` 参数将被忽略。The `control` parameter is ignored.
